This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the content of the column header.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> <div class="api-container appended-doc"> <h1>TableRow</h1> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-table-row component represents a row in the ui5-table. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the cells of the <code>ui5-table-row</code>. <br><b>Note:</b> Use <code>ui5-table-cell</code> for the intended design.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> <div class="api-container appended-doc"> <h1>TableCell</h1> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-table-cell component defines the structure of the data in a single ui5-table cell. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> firstInRow <br> <code>first-in-row</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">undefined</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell"></div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> lastInRow <br> <code>last-in-row</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">undefined</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell"></div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> popined <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">undefined</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell"></div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Specifies the content of the <code>ui5-table-cell</code>.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

30.title: Text Area
30.content: TextArea <ui5-textarea> Basic TextArea <ui5-textarea placeholder="Type as much text as you wish"></ui5-textarea> TextArea with Maximum Length <ui5-textarea placeholder="Type some text" max-length="10" show-exceeded-text></ui5-textarea> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-textarea component provides large spaces for text entries in the form of multiple rows. It has the functionality of the TextField with the additional functionality for multiline texts. When empty, it can hold a placeholder similar to a ui5-input. You can define the rows of the ui5-textarea and also determine specific behavior when handling long texts. ES6 Module Import import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/TextArea"; <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> disabled <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Indicates whether the user can interact with the component or not. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> Disabled components cannot be focused and they are out of the tab chain. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> growing <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Enables the <code>ui5-textarea</code> to automatically grow and shrink dynamically with its content. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> If set to <code>true</code>, the CSS <code>height</code> property is ignored. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> growingMaxLines <br> <code>growing-max-lines</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">number</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">0</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the maximum number of lines that the Web Component can grow. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> maxLength <br> <code>max-length</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">number</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell"></div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the maximum number of characters that the <code>value</code> can have. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> name <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell"></div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Determines the name with which the <code>ui5-textarea</code> will be submitted in an HTML form. <b>Important:</b> For the <code>name</code> property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: <code>import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";</code> <b>Note:</b> When set, a native <code>input</code> HTML element will be created inside the <code>ui5-textarea</code> so that it can be submitted as part of an HTML form. Do not use this property unless you need to submit a form. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> placeholder <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the component has no value. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> readonly <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the <code>ui5-textarea</code> is readonly. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> A readonly <code>ui5-textarea</code> is not editable, but still provides visual feedback upon user interaction. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> required <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the <code>ui5-textarea</code> is required. <div class="api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-content-cell-since">since v1.0.0</div> </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> rows <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">number</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">0</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the number of visible text lines for the component. <br><br> <b>Notes:</b> <ul> <li>If the <code>growing</code> property is enabled, this property defines the minimum rows to be displayed in the textarea.</li> <li>The CSS <code>height</code> property wins over the <code>rows</code> property, if both are set.</li> </ul> </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> showExceededText <br> <code>show-exceeded-text</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Determines whether the characters exceeding the maximum allowed character count are visible in the <code>ui5-textarea</code>. <br><br> If set to <code>false</code>, the user is not allowed to enter more characters than what is set in the <code>maxLength</code> property. If set to <code>true</code> the characters exceeding the <code>maxLength</code> value are selected on paste and the counter below the <code>ui5-textarea</code> displays their number. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> value <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the value of the Web Component. </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Events</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component fires semantic events upon user interaction. You can bind to these events with the standard DOM APIs, such as <code>addEventListener</code>. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">change</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the text has changed and the focus leaves the <code>ui5-textarea</code>. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">input</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the value of the <code>ui5-textarea</code> changes at each keystroke or when something is pasted. <div class="api-table-content-cell-bold api-table-content-cell-since">since vundefined</div> </div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

31.title: Timeline
31.content: Timeline v0.8.0 <ui5-timeline> Basic Timeline MR SOF02 2.43 Online meeting <ui5-timeline> <ui5-timeline-item id="test-item" title-text="called" subtitle-text="20.02.2017 11:30" icon="sap-icon://phone" item-name="John Smith" item-name-clickable></ui5-timeline-item> <ui5-timeline-item title-text="Weekly Sync - CP Design" subtitle-text="27.07.2017 (11:00 - 12:30)" icon="sap-icon://calendar"> <div>MR SOF02 2.43</div> </ui5-timeline-item> <ui5-timeline-item title-text="Video Converence Call - UI5" subtitle-text="31.01.2018 (12:00 - 13:00)" icon="sap-icon://calendar"> <div>Online meeting</div> </ui5-timeline-item> </ui5-timeline> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The timeline control shows entries (such as objects, events, or posts) in chronological order. A common use case is to provide information about changes to an object, or events related to an object. These entries can be generated by the system (for example, value XY changed from A to B), or added manually. There are two distinct variants of the timeline: basic and social. The basic timeline is read-only, while the social timeline offers a high level of interaction and collaboration, and is integrated within SAP Jam. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">HTMLElement [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Determines the content of the <code>ui5-timeline</code>.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <div class="api-container appended-doc"> <h1>TimelineItem</h1> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> An entry posted on the timeline. <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> icon <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element within the <code>ui5-timeline-item</code>. SAP-icons font provides numerous options. <br><br> See all the available icons in the <ui5-link target="_blank" href="https://openui5.hana.ondemand.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html" class="api-table-content-cell-link">Icon Explorer</ui5-link>. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> itemName <br> <code>item-name</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the name of the item. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> itemNameClickable <br> <code>item-name-clickable</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the <code>itemName</code> is clickable. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> subtitleText <br> <code>subtitle-text</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell"></div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the subtitle text of the component. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> titleText <br> <code>title-text</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell"></div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the title text of the component. </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Determines the description of the <code>ui5-timeline-item</code>.</div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Events</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component fires semantic events upon user interaction. You can bind to these events with the standard DOM APIs, such as <code>addEventListener</code>. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">itemNameClick</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the item name is pressed either with a click/tap or by using the Enter or Space key. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> The event will not be fired if the <code>item-name-clickable</code> attribute is not set. </div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

32.title: Title
32.content: Title <ui5-title> Title in All Available Levels Title level 1 Title level 2 Title level 3 Title level 4 Title level 5 Title level 6 <ui5-title level="H1">Title level 1</ui5-title> <ui5-title level="H2">Title level 2</ui5-title> <ui5-title level="H3">Title level 3</ui5-title> <ui5-title level="H4">Title level 4</ui5-title> <ui5-title level="H5">Title level 5</ui5-title> <ui5-title level="H6">Title level 6</ui5-title> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-title component is used to display titles inside a page. It is a simple, large-sized text with explicit header/title semantics. ES6 Module Import import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Title"; <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> level <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;H2&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the <code>ui5-title</code> level. Available options are: <code>"H6"</code> to <code>"H1"</code>. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> wrap <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the <code>ui5-title</code> would wrap. </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the text of the <code>ui5-title</code>. <br><b>Note:</b> Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.</div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

33.content: ToggleButton <ui5-togglebutton> ToggleButton States ToggleButton Pressed ToggleButton Disabled ToggleButton Disabled ToggleButton Accept ToggleButton Accept ToggleButton Reject ToggleButton Reject ToggleButton Transparent ToggleButton Transparent ToggleButton <ui5-togglebutton>ToggleButton</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton pressed>Pressed ToggleButton</ui5-togglebutton> ToggleButton</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Positive" pressed>Accept ToggleButton</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Negative">Reject ToggleButton</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Negative" pressed>Reject ToggleButton</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Transparent">Transparent ToggleButton</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Transparent" pressed>Transparent ToggleButton</ui5-togglebutton> ToggleButton with Icon Menu Add Back Accept Deny <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://menu">Menu</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Emphasized" icon="sap-icon://add">Add</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Default" icon="sap-icon://nav-back">Back</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Positive" icon="sap-icon://accept">Accept</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Negative" icon="sap-icon://sys-cancel">Deny</ui5-togglebutton> ToggleButton with Icon Only <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://accept"></ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://action-settings" pressed></ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://add"></ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://alert" pressed></ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://away" design="Positive"></ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://bookmark" design="Positive" pressed></ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://cancel" design="Negative"></ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://call" design="Negative" pressed></ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://camera" design="Transparent"></ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton icon="sap-icon://cart" design="Transparent" pressed></ui5-togglebutton> ToggleButton Yes/No Yes/No Toggle Button Toggle Button pressed On/Off On/Off Menu Menu Transparent Transparent <ui5-togglebutton>Yes/No</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton pressed>Yes/No</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton>Toggle Button</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton pressed>Toggle Button pressed</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Positive">On/Off</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Positive" pressed>On/Off</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Negative">Menu</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Negative" pressed>Menu</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Transparent">Transparent</ui5-togglebutton> <ui5-togglebutton design="Transparent" pressed>Transparent</ui5-togglebutton> <div class="page-container"> <div class="api-container"> <section class="component-description"> <h3 class="comment-api-title">Overview</h3> The ui5-togglebutton component is an enhanced ui5-button that can be toggled between pressed and normal states. Users can use the ui5-togglebutton as a switch to turn a setting on or off. It can also be used to represent an independent choice similar to a check box. Clicking or tapping on a ui5-togglebutton changes its state to pressed. The button returns to its initial state when the user clicks or taps on it again. By applying additional custom CSS-styling classes, apps can give a different style to any ui5-togglebutton. ES6 Module Import import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/ToggleButton"; <section class="component-api space-top"> <h3 class="comment-api-title" >Properties/Attributes</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >You can use both properties and attributes with the same effect. The name of each attribute is listed below the name of the property, if different.</p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Default Value</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> pressed <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Determines whether the <code>ui5-togglebutton</code> is displayed as pressed. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> design <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">ButtonDesign</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;Default&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the <code>ui5-button</code> design. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> Available options are "Default", "Emphasized", "Positive", "Negative", and "Transparent". </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> disabled <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the <code>ui5-button</code> is disabled (default is set to <code>false</code>). A disabled <code>ui5-button</code> can't be pressed or focused, and it is not in the tab chain. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> icon <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">string</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">&quot;&quot;</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element within the <code>ui5-button</code>. The SAP-icons font provides numerous options. <br><br> Example: <br> <pre>ui5-button icon="sap-icon://palette"</pre> See all the available icons in the <ui5-link target="_blank" href="https://openui5.hana.ondemand.com/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html" class="api-table-content-cell-link">Icon Explorer</ui5-link>. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> iconEnd <br> <code>icon-end</code> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Defines whether the icon should be displayed after the <code>ui5-button</code> text. </div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-odd"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold"> submits <br> </div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">boolean</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">false</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> When set to <code>true</code>, the <code>ui5-button</code> will automatically submit the nearest form element upon <code>press</code>. <b>Important:</b> For the <code>submits</code> property to have effect, you must add the following import to your project: <code>import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/features/InputElementsFormSupport.js";</code> </div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top" >Slots</h3> <p class="small-space-top" > This Element provides slot(s). This means it can display its child nodes.<br> Unless targeting the default slot, use the <code>slot</code> attribute to define the destination slot for each child.<br> Text, along with HTML Elements with no <code>slot</code> attribute, goes the the <code>default</code> slot. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Slot</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Type</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">default</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell">Node [0..n]</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description">Defines the text of the <code>ui5-button</code>. <br><b>Note:</b> Аlthough this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that you only use text in order to preserve the intended design.</div> </div> </div> <h3 class="comment-api-title space-top">Events</h3> <p class="small-space-top" >This Web Component fires semantic events upon user interaction. You can bind to these events with the standard DOM APIs, such as <code>addEventListener</code>. </p> <div class="small-space-top api-table"> <div class="head api-table-header-roll"> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Name</div> <div class="cell api-table-header-cell">Description</div> </div> <div class="row api-table-roll-even"> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-bold">click</div> <div class="cell api-table-content-cell api-table-content-cell-description"> Fired when the <code>ui5-button</code> is activated either with a mouse/tap or by using the Enter or Space key. <br><br> <b>Note:</b> The event will not be fired if the <code>disabled</code> property is set to <code>true</code>. </div> </div> </div> </section> </section> </div> </div> <footer class="footer-wrapper"> <div class="footer-links"> <a class="separator" href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/privacy.html" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a> <a href="https://www.sap.com/about/legal/impressum.html" target="_blank">Legal</a> </div> <img src="../../../../../../assets/images/sap-logo-svg.svg" alt="Sap Logo" /> </footer>

34.title: Vue
34.content: Get Started with UI5 Web Components & VueJS In this tutorial you will learn how to add UI5 Web Components to your application. The UI5 Web Components can be added both to new VueJS applications, as well as already existing ones. Step 1. Install Vue CLI npm install -g @vue/cli Step 2. Init New App vue create ui5-web-components-application cd ui5-web-components-application Step 3. Add UI5 Web Components npm install @ui5/webcomponents --save Step 4. Add UI5 Web Components to Vue ignoredElement Add the following line to your main.js file: Vue.config.ignoredElements = [/^ui5-/]; Step 5. Import the Components That You Are Going to Use import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Button"; Step 6. Use the Imported Elements in Your Application <ui5-button>Hello world!</ui5-button> Step 7: Launch the Application yarn serve Additional Two-Way Data Binding v-model binding doesn’t work as expected for custom elements. In order to use two way data binding, you should bind and update the value yourself like this: <ui5-input :value="inputValue" @input="inputValue = $event.target.value"> </ui5-input>

37.title: Getting Started
37.content: Getting Started The UI5 Web Components share fundamental UI5 qualities with others to provide enterprise-grade features, Fiori UX and themeability. The goal is to achieve an easy consumption of UI5 controls to lower the entry barrier to use UI5 controls for own applications and to avoid complexity of UI5 rendering-stack by making the consumption of the full-stack UI5 optional. In general, the UI5 Web Components are targeting for Web Developers who want to have more flexibility to use just HTML tags or arbitrary JS frameworks. Installation Install @ui5/webcomponents npm install @ui5/webcomponents Read the Docs Documentation and tutorials about UI5 Web Components can be found here Usage Import the needed Web Component import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/Button"; Instantiate Web Component <ui5-button>Hello world!</ui5-button> Enjoy UI5 Web Components
